member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions
member.summary: Options used to create a new cookie.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default cookie with a path of '/'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.Domain
member.summary: Gets or sets the domain to associate the cookie with.
member.returns: The domain to associate the cookie with.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the cookie path.
member.returns: The cookie path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.Expires
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration date and time for the cookie.
member.returns: The expiration date and time for the cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.Secure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to transmit the cookie using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL)ï¿½that is, over HTTPS only.
member.returns: true to transmit the cookie only over an SSL connection (HTTPS); otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions.HttpOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cookie is accessible by client-side script.
member.returns: true if a cookie is accessible by client-side script; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString
member.summary: Provides correct handling for FragmentString value when needed to generate a URI string

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.Empty
member.summary: Represents the empty fragment string. This field is read-only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the fragment string with a given value. This value must be in escaped and delimited format with a leading '#' character.
member.param: The fragment string to be assigned to the Value property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.Value
member.summary: The escaped fragment string with the leading '#' character

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.HasValue
member.summary: True if the fragment string is not empty

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.ToString
member.summary: Provides the fragment string escaped in a way which is correct for combining into the URI representation. A leading '#' character will be included unless the Value is null or empty. Characters which are potentially dangerous are escaped.
member.returns: The fragment string value

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.ToUriComponent
member.summary: Provides the fragment string escaped in a way which is correct for combining into the URI representation. A leading '#' character will be included unless the Value is null or empty. Characters which are potentially dangerous are escaped.
member.returns: The fragment string value

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.FromUriComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an FragmentString given the fragment as it is escaped in the URI format. The string MUST NOT contain any value that is not a fragment.
member.param: The escaped fragment as it appears in the URI format.
member.returns: The resulting FragmentString

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.FragmentString.FromUriComponent(System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns an FragmentString given the fragment as from a Uri object. Relative Uri objects are not supported.
member.returns: The resulting FragmentString

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString
member.summary: Represents the host portion of a URI can be used to construct URI's properly formatted and encoded for use in HTTP headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString without modification. The value should be Unicode rather than punycode, and may have a port. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are also allowed, and also may have ports.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.Value
member.summary: Returns the original value from the constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the value as normalized by ToUriComponent().

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.ToUriComponent
member.summary: Returns the value properly formatted and encoded for use in a URI in a HTTP header. Any Unicode is converted to punycode. IPv6 addresses will have brackets added if they are missing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.FromUriComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString from the given URI component. Any punycode will be converted to Unicode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.FromUriComponent(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString from the host and port of the give Uri instance. Punycode will be converted to Unicode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.Equals(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString)
member.summary: Compares the equality of the Value property, ignoring case.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares against the given object only if it is a HostString.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.op_Equality(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString)
member.summary: Compares the two instances for equality.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString.op_Inequality(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HostString)
member.summary: Compares the two instances for inequality.
